intro: Stelis euthema, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant features a pseudobulb and produces delicate, showy flowers in shades of white and pink. Its roots are adapted to absorb moisture from the surrounding soil. Stelis euthema is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia.
